title: PayPal
description: I served as a tech lead for consumer send-money web team. My main responsibility at PayPal was to add new features and maintain the send money web experience. I created the architecture for integrating the send money web experience into internal and external partnerships such as PayPal.me and Outlook.com

title: HomeAway
description: I was one of the front end engineers for the global traveler team at HomeAway. During my time there, I added the ability to 'Favorites' properties, built a kanban management tool named 'Dillernator', built out the luxury version of Homeaway (luxury.homeaway.com), and migrated a vanillajs codebase to Backbone. Every two weeks I would make presentations to my team on new technologies, as well as opening discussion on ways we can improve our code base. Outside of my team work, I hosted company-wide hackathons.

title: Razorfish
description: I started my career working on front-end experiences at Razorfish. My work ranged from building websites in flash, asp.net, jQuery, mobile-web, to building advertisements on the back of the chairs on air planes.

title: Personal
description: I've worked on a variety of personal projects. Most of my projects are built with a side-intention of exploring new technologies. Some of my projects include: Websockets of life, a websocket implementation of Conway's Game of Life, Dom-to-canvas, a vanillajs dom-tree render, and WonderTradeAnalytics.com, an express webapp that displays graphs based on user submitted wonder trade data.
